column1:
legogal,"2016-06-02T00:05:40.073Z","Amazing fountain for that perfect park setting!","

At US LEGO stores beginning today, buy $80. of LEGO and receive Creator set 40221, the fountain, for free. It is a sweet small build with 105 pieces and fits perfectly in your LEGO city of any sort.
The box and instructions show a nice park setting with a lady feeding her dog a cookie while she reads the LEGO newspaper. A tall BLEY
column2: figure with large pearl gold wings sits atop a cute fountain that should enhance any LEGO scene. There are two four stud long park benches, a dark red trash bin and a lime planter with flowers next to the benches. Her BLO bike is nearby.

column1: The parts and minifigs look like standard fare
column2: not much new there except maybe the trans backpack holder where the wings are mounted on the back of the statue (part 6100958.)&nbsp

column1: It is a simple build that takes about two minutes and looks instantly adorable. It makes you want to hug the fountain, the dog and the lady....that is how cute it is. There are countless ways to incorporate this into anything you are building.
column2: (And we all love chilling out at a park. On rainy days, you can pretend you are sitting on that bench!)

column1: The design is quite nice being compact and yet expandable to fit whatever scene you build.
column2: Add some of her friends and family, and you have an instant picnic in the park. &nbsp
column3: A couple of soccer balls and you have an instant match. &nbsp
column5: t forget the other plants and trees, food and drink, and pets.&nbsp

column1: This set is lovely because it is quite
column2: adaptable and so darn cute. With huge&nbsp
column3: playability, it ranks high on my list. Thanks, LEGO, for such a perfect gift. This is one you will not want to miss.

column1:
,TRUE,5,4,3,5,5 UKBRiCKS","2016-06-03T10:29:17.513Z","Great colour bike and interchangeable statue, nice! ","

This was a giveaway promotion from June 2016
column3: 50 in the UK and $75 in the US.&nbsp

column1: We have seen a similar statue in one of the City Square sets from a couple of years back but
this fountain can be used quite easily in LEGO city and Town displays and would look very
effective without the need for customisation.&nbsp

column2: s take a closer look at what is included in this set. The fountain has some nice water

column1: elements which stick up to demonstrate the water feature. Around the sides there is detailing
with 4 of the gold frogs which I think look very good.&nbsp
The statue is similar to what we have seen before but I do like the golden wings on the back.

column2: t know about the set before building it is the statue can be changed out for a

column1: Female version, so currently we are seeing the Male version complete with Helmet, Beard and&nbsp
column2: Sword and when you switch out those elements and replace them with Female hair piece and Flag&nbsp
column3: pole and golden flag. I really like they have included these extra elements, particularly the&nbsp
column4: grey hair piece something that is less common.&nbsp

column1: Another great feature in this set is the bike in the new colour, the Yellowish Orange which we
have only seen in one other set before.&nbsp
Of course we have seen this dog before with this print and is pretty common but again nice to
The set also comes with not one but two dark blue park benches which are four studs wide, you
column2: can just about fit 2 minifigures on these if you balance them however only one fits on their&nbsp
column3: comfortably but next to the benches you have a pot plant and flowers on one side and a dustbin&nbsp
column4: for your rubbish on the other side.&nbsp

column1: We get one minifigure in this set (excluding the statue) which comes with the press pass torso
column2: which is always a handy one to get. The face is standard as we get with all LEGO creator sets&nbsp
column3: and the yellow hair piece is pretty standard. She comes with a cookie and the LEGO news tile piece.&nbsp

column1: I quite like this set, probably more so because it is free LEGO however that asside it is a set I would pay £
column2: 5 for so I think it is almost big enough and good enough to be a set in its own right.&nbsp

column1: Getting the new colour bike for free without having to purchase in the LEGO Friends set or off bricklink is very good and the interchangable statue is a nice touch.
I would give this a respectable 72 / 100. There is nothing wrong with this set as it is free LEGO. Perhaps they could have included a couple of LEGO coins to make it a '

,TRUE,4,5,4,3,5 indykid","2020-08-14T21:49:16.49Z","Great addition to any LEGO City","

I recently got this for free after redeeming some VIP points for it on
column3: s a neat little set and the price (free or at least some VIP points) really sweetened the deal.

column1: The build is nothing special but all the parts are great, especially everything included with the fountain. The customizability is a plus. I know the instructions have 2 options for the fountain statue but there'
column2: s room to mix and match, especially since the set comes with an extra sword piece. The pearl gold frogs and all the trans blue elements are great. The blue benches are a fun and different color. The trash bin has a super simple yet really effective design. The reporter minifig is good
column3: I collect modulars but I don&#39
column7: s a welcome addition, especially as I am partial to the classic minifig heads in the modular series. The yellow bike is also really cool.

column2: s a fair amount of room for playability but it works better when combined with other sets. I know it&#39
column3: s supposed to be a companion piece for the modular series (or at least that&#39
column4: s what the advertising on the instruction booklet implies) but it would fit in great with any City theme set as well.

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,3,4,5 Hylocera","2016-06-20T03:04:44.363Z","It's FREE","

The title pretty much sums up all I need to say in this review: FREE. LEGO. But, if you want to know more about this "
Nothing special here. Typical square box used for $10 sets, with an instruction booklet folded in half and 2 bags inside: 1 for small parts, and
Goodness this is a good parts pack. It'
column2: s pretty much everything you can see: pearl gold frogs, yellow-orange bike, lime green inverted dome, grass stalk with 6 branches, etc. The only things you can&#39
column4: are the trans-clear neck bracket for mounting the statue&#39
column5: s wings, and a 6x6 round medium azure plate on the base of the fountain.

column2: s where it starts to get a little ridiculous.

column1: Ok, so the lady has a plain smiley face. Whatever. Her torso with the press nametag comes in 5 other sets, the cheapest of which is $40 (the other options are $50, $60, $150, and $200). Needless to say, if you want this torso and other good pieces, this is easily the best option. She has a cookie and a printed (PRINTED) 2x2 white tile with a newspaper design. Admittedly, this piece appears in 16 other sets, but it is a nice addition regardless. As nice as this fig is, what really impresses me is the statue.
The statue has plain light bley legs, torso, and head
column2: the torso has dark bley hands, which is unfortunate, but it&#39
column3: s barely noticeable. The helmet is rare-ish in light bley. What&#39
column4: s amazing is that this isn&#39
column5: t the only statue you can make. LEGO could have just left it at this knight guy with wings (before I forget
column6: the golden wings are a bit distracting from the bley color scheme). But instead, they included a hairpiece that you can switch out with the helmet and a flag (not pictured) that you can switch out with, or add to, the sword. Fantastic feature, especially for a promotional.

column1: Since this is a free set, the criteria of value and all that changes a little bit. It'

Yes. Absolutely, yes. It is worth it. The above picture shows the set in its entirety, plus 6 extras. I would spend $15 on this as a normal set, just for all the rare parts and pretty colors, but for free? :)

column13: > Given away last year by LEGO this set was put out for sale recently, at least at my local LEGO Store and I&rsquo
column14: m pleased to have this opportunity to add it to my collection. This is a nice little set meant to compliment your Modular Buildings. I am a big fan of what&#39
column15: s here, and this review shall attempt to explain why.

column9: s a box design meant to compliment the Modular series of LEGO Expert Builds and this box really stood out to me when I found it at The LEGO Store, so it does a great job of drawing your eye. Love the design of this box and the images on the front and back showcase this set perfectly.

column8: >Instructions: Very straight forward manual, the design is everything you expect in a LEGO manual. There are no cross-promotional pages dedicated to sets of this sort, but the back cover has a great picture of the Modulars on it.

column9: t the best parts pack, but it does include some nice elements. The Weeping Angel hair piece, some pearl gold wing pieces a nice mustard yellow bike and one of the six-sided stem pieces for plants just to name a few. Definitely some decent parts.

column8: >Press Woman/Reporter: Not much to say about this Minifigure, she&rsquo
column9: ll look fine when put next to other figures, but her parts are all relatively common at this point with possible exception to her torso, which I believe has only appeared in a handful of sets to date. It&rsquo
column10: s a double-sided print with a red suit jacket, an ID badge clipped on to one side and a black undershirt visible beneath. She gets The LEGO News accessory tile and a printed cookie element.

column8: >Statue: This is a plain grey figure, meant to represent a statue it has no printed detailing. All of the parts are grey/bley in colour with exception to the back bracket and gold wings for the look of the figure. There are two options, a sword, helmet and beard are used for a male statue, while a flag and female hair piece can be attached to change into a female character.
>There are three primary elements in this build, the fountain itself, two benches and that&rsquo
column9: s about it. The bench sections are fairly repetitive, the differences is the trash can on one plate and the flower planter on the other. The fountain itself is a much more satisfying build, the fact that you use Chima crystals for water effects is very clever and the four pearl gold frog decorations add to the ambiance of the model, if that makes sense.

d estimate a fifteen to twenty minute build total for all involved, with no difficult steps to trip up builders. Building the small waste basket next to the bench is the only irritant, there are four grate style elements used to attach to a four-sided headlight style brick and the clutch power is definitely weaker because of this. It does make for a very nice detailed element though as we&rsquo
column10: ll discuss in the next section.

column8: >Fountain: This model looks breathtaking, with a circular design and Chi crystals used for water fountain detailing the statue in the center is left to stand out quite nicely on a podium that resembles old style architecture. The four golden frog elements surround it to enhance the details of the fountain.
>This model is truly deserving of being owned and appreciated, it is the highlight of the set and would look great in any display.

>Add-Ons: Two benches of identical build and design compliment the main model quite nicely. The rich dark blue colours chosen enhance the overall look of the completed models once put side-by-side and each bench has a unique accessory element chosen to enhance the visual identity.

>One is an outdoor flower planter with a six-stem flower piece and a mixture of purple and rose coloured blooms, the second is a very nicely engineered little trash basket with a very cleverly built aesthetic choice to compliment the look. Also included is either a light orange or dark yellow bike, I&rsquo
column9: m a bit unsure precisely however I do know it&rsquo
column10: s a rare colour for that element and of course the LEGO dog piece to round everything off.

column8: >This is one of the best small boxed sets I&rsquo
column9: ve ever purchased from LEGO, the overall look and package is excellently put together and if you are a fan of such classic builds I wholeheartedly recommend it. Include it with the Modular of your choice and this set is going to look excellent on display. By now it is more than likely only available on the secondary market, so try to find a good deal on it if you can.

column1:
,TRUE,5,4,4,4,5 matthew1208","2016-07-30T01:47:00.123Z","A Great Free Set","

In June of 2016, this set was available if you spent $75 or more. I was able to buy the Fun in the park set and the maze , with a two pick a brick cups, to get this set,
These were some of the great parts that came in this set
There was the lady minfig. She has a smiling face. With a pony tale hair. The set also came with the dog. The statue
column2: could be changed out to be a woman.&nbsp

column1: The build was easy and simple, but looks great. It is a statue with a fountain going around it. To make the water they used crystal
column3: in transparent blue. The set also comes with two benches, one with flowers and one with a garage can.&nbsp

column1: Overall this set is wonderful, And its FREE!!! I would say that you should get this set if do not have it.
